704904f-a.text:
Hicks Street, west side, at Fulton Street. Also shown is 43-51 Fulton Street, north side, at the foot of Hicks Street. The Lenox House is at No. 43. The Fulton Street Elevated Lines of the B.M.T. are in the
foreground.
February 5, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
704904f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY

704470f-b.text:
Fulton Street, between Hicks and Water Streets, showing different phases of W.P.A. highway and sewer operations. View 4 shows part of the Brooklyn Bridge and the skeleton of a new storehouse for the Department of Purchase. In the background is the Manhattan Bridge.

1936
Views 1, 2, 3, 4

Works Project Administration
Five Boroughs Project

704470f-d.folder: Fulton Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY

704479f-a.text:
47 Fulton Street, north side, at the head of Hicks Street, showing the old Long Island Bank, established in 1824. The bank occupied this building fromm 1876 to 1880. In 1892 the bank was at 186 Remsen Strret. A broom selling concern later took over the builditg. Two signs at the entrance to the building read: "Spriral Tube Brushes"
and "Rattan-Bass Push Brooms."
1923
Views 1,2
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection
(3)
Another view of the old bank building.
February 5, 1931
P. L. Sperr
704479f-a.folder: Fulton Street & Hicks Street, Brooklyn, NY

704905f-a.text:
Hicks Street, east side, south of Fulton Street, to and including Poplar Street. The buildings in the background, south of Poplar Street have since 1905 been demolished and P.S. No. 2 is on the site. The second building from the foreground, made of frame, has been replaced by a one story brick building. Note the gathering making ready for a
picnic trip.
About 1905.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
704905f-a.folder: Hicks Street & Fulton Street, Brooklyn, NY
